alert.note: Alert for Parker Valley (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 22 at 7:46PM MST until February 22 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...BLOWING DUST ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 8 PM MST /7 PM PST/ THIS EVENING... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST /9 PM PST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arizona and southeast and southern California. * WHEN...For the Blowing Dust Advisory, until 8 PM MST /7 PM PST/ this evening. For the Wind Advisory, until 10 PM MST /9 PM PST/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.
